metadata.titleEn: Geochemical data of adakitic rocks in baoshujian, Anqing Guichi ore concentration area
metadata.description: The data are the whole rock major and trace data, Sr nd Pb isotopic data, zircon U-Pb dating data and pyrite S isotopic data of adakitic rocks in baoshujian, Anqing Guichi ore concentration area. The major element data of the whole rock were obtained by XRF analysis, trace element data by ICP-MS analysis, zircon U-Pb dating and in-situ Lu Hf isotopic composition data by la-mc-icp-ms analysis, and pyrite S isotopic composition data by MC-ICP-MS analysis. The above data have been published in high-level SCI journals, and the data are true and reliable. Through the obtained data, we can explore and summarize the diagenetic process and mineralization of baoshujian mining area, and then fill in the gap in the mineralization period of 1455ma in the Guichi ore concentration area of Anqing, and provide theoretical support for the prospecting work of baoshujian and even the whole Guichi ore concentration area of Anqing. At the same time, it has a certain guiding significance for the division of metallogenic epoch in the middle and lower reaches of the Yangtze River.
metadata.instructions: The geochemical data are stored in word format, and the sample name is "YY DD XX", where YY is the sampling year, DD is the sampling place name, and XX is the sample serial number

Feature Specification.Question: What are the characteristics of the geochemical data collection methods used for adakite-like rocks in mineral zones?
Feature Specification.Answer: XRF analysis for whole rock major elements, ICP-MS for trace elements, LA-MC-ICP-MS for zircon U-Pb dating and in-situ Lu-Hf isotopic composition, MC-ICP-MS for pyrite S isotopes

Quantification.Question: How many types of isotopic analyses are employed in a dataset related to adakitic rocks in the Anqing-Guichi mineral district?

Definition.Question: What are the standard geochemical data collection methods used for analyzing Adakitic rocks in the context of a mineral district?
Definition.Answer: The standard geochemical data collection methods include the analysis of whole-rock major elements using X-ray fluorescence (XRF), trace elements using inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry (ICP-MS), zircon U-Pb dating and in-situ Lu-Hf isotope composition using laser ablation multi-collector ICP-MS (LA-MC-ICP-MS), and pyrite sulfur isotope analysis using multi-collector ICP-MS (MC-ICP-MS).

Causal Consequence.Question: What are the potential outcomes of using advanced geochemical analysis techniques like LA-MC-ICP-MS and MC-ICP-MS on understanding the diagenetic processes and mineralization in the Baoshuijian mineral area?
Causal Consequence.Answer: Using advanced geochemical analysis techniques such as LA-MC-ICP-MS for zircon U-Pb dating and MC-ICP-MS for sulfur isotopes in pyrite can lead to a more accurate understanding of the diagenetic processes and mineralization in the Baoshuijian mineral area. These methods allow for precise dating and isotopic composition analysis, which can fill the knowledge gap regarding the mineralization period around 145.5 Ma in the Anqing-Guichi mineral district. This can provide theoretical support for mineral exploration in Baoshuijian and the broader Anqing-Guichi area, and also offer insights into the division of mineralization ages in the middle and lower reaches of the Yangtze River.

Instrumental/Procedural.Question: What procedures and analytical techniques are used to collect and process geochemical and isotopic data for studying the petrogenesis and metallogenesis of adakitic rocks in mining areas?
Instrumental/Procedural.Answer: The data collection involves multiple analytical techniques: whole-rock major elements are obtained using X-ray fluorescence (XRF) analysis, trace elements are measured through inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry (ICP-MS), zircon U-Pb dating and in-situ Lu-Hf isotopic composition are analyzed using laser ablation multi-collector ICP-MS (LA-MC-ICP-MS), and sulfur isotopes in pyrite are measured with MC-ICP-MS. These methods enable a comprehensive exploration of the petrogenesis and metallogenesis processes in the mining area.
